const isPrime = (n) => {
    if (n == 1) return false
    if (n == 2) return true
    if (n % 2 == 0) return false
    let x = 1
    while (x * x <= n) {
        if (n % x == 0) return false
        x += 1
    }
    return true
}

/**
  * Return the number of possible prime numbers below n.
  * @param n The number to check.
  * @return number The number of possible prime numbers below n.
  * @example
  * ```javascript
  * // import isPrime from './prime'
  * isPrime(6) // false
  * isPrime(101) // true
  * isPrime(11) // true
  * isPrime(13441) // true
  * isPrime(61) // true
  * isPrime(4) // false
  * isPrime(1) // false
  * ```
  */
const numberOfPrimeNumbers = (n) => {
    let count = 0
    let x = 1
    while (x * x <= n) {
        if (isPrime(x)) count++
        x += 1
    }
    return count
}

/**
  * Returns a list of prime numbers.
  * @param n The number to check.
  * @return List The list of prime numbers.
  * @example
  * ```javascript
  * // import prime from './prime'
  * prime(101) // [101]
  * prime(6) // [2, 3, 5]
  * prime(5) // [2, 3, 5]
  * prime(4) // [2, 3]
  * prime(3) // [3]
  * prime(2) // [2]
  * prime(1) // [1]
  * ```
  */
const prime = (n) => {
    let primes = []
    let x = 1
    while (x * x <= n) {
        if (isPrime(x)) primes.push(x)
        x += 1
    }
    return primes

 and return the result as a string. If shift > number of digit, return digit reversing.
  >>> circularShift(12, 1)
  "21"
  >>> circularShift(12, 2)
  "12"
  */
const circularShift = (x, shift) => {
  const length = x.length
  const shiftLength = length - shift
  let res = ''
  for (let i = 0; i < shiftLength; i++) {
    res += x[length - i - 1]
  }
  return res + x[0]
}

  primeLength('Hello') == true
  primeLength('abcdcba') == true
  primeLength('kittens') == true
  primeLength('orange') == false

  let primeNumber = false;
  for (let i = 2; i < string.length; i++) {
    if (string.length % i === 0) {
      primeNumber = false;
      break;
    }
  }
  return primeNumber;
};

    return = ['One']
  */
const byLength = (arr) => {
  const names = ["One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine"]
  const sorted = arr.sort((a, b) => a - b)
  const reversed = sorted.reverse()
  const replace = (value, names) => names[value - 1]
  return sorted.map(replace)
}

  minSubArraySum([-1, -2, -3]) == -6
  */
const minSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  const [len, nums] = [nums.length, nums]
  let [min, sum] = [nums[0], nums[0]]
  for (let i = 1; i < len; i++) {
    sum += nums[i]
    if (sum < min) min = sum
    if (sum < 0) sum = 0
  }
  return sum
}
